title: Who was the first Indian to fight against the British? - Quora

response.answer_text: n 1825 in Karnataka, Kitturu Rani Chennamma rejected Doctrine of Lapsi and refused British company rulers any royalty. She defeated British in the war. Kittur was defeated by British army in the second war. In 1885, at the suggestion of Allan Octavian Hume (a British civil servant, born in Kent, England), and seventy-three Indian delegates met in Bombay. They founded the Indian National Congress. They were the first two important figures whom set the wheels in motion for Indian independence, ironic that one of the most important figures for India’s independence was a British man, considering the narrative set by the BJP and other nationalists.

It is recorded in history, the mighty Mughals resisted them and the Siraj ud Daulah of Bengal and the great Tipu Sultan. The British corrupted and cunningly ruled India, they used to bribe the commander and make way for them.
